@@info: Here are translations that exist in <en> but not in secondary locales.
After editing this file, you can run 'flutter pub run slang apply --locale=<locale>' to quickly apply the newly added translations.

faq(OUTDATED).a: Nextcloud is a private file sync server, among other things. You can use the default Saber Nextcloud server, use a third-party server, or self-host your own for full control of your data.

The encryption password is used to encrypt your data before it is sent to the server. You choose it when you first login to Saber, and it's not related to your Nextcloud account/password.

No-one can access your notes on the server without your encryption password. This also means that if you forget your encryption password, you will lose access to your data.

The Nextcloud password is used to access the cloud. The encryption password "scrambles" your data before it ever reaches the cloud.

Even if someone gains access to your Nextcloud account, your notes will remain safe and encrypted with a separate password. This provides you a second layer of security to protect your data.

faq(OUTDATED).q: How do I login if I use 2FA?
faq(OUTDATED).a: Instead of your regular Nextcloud password, you'll need to create an "app password". You can do this in your Nextcloud settings under Security > Devices & sessions > Create new app password. Your encryption password is unaffected.

faq(OUTDATED).q: Can I use the same password for both?
faq(OUTDATED).a: Yes, but doing so is less secure. Since your Nextcloud password is sent to the server, someone with access to the server would be able to decrypt your notes. Only use the same password if you trust the server owner.

Nextcloud è un server di sincronizzazione file privato, tra le altre cose. Puoi utilizzare il server Saber Nextcloud predefinito, utilizzare un server di terze parti o ospitare autonomamente il tuo per il pieno controllo dei tuoi dati.

faq(OUTDATED).q: Qual è la password di crittografia?
faq(OUTDATED).a:
La password di crittografia viene utilizzata per crittografare i dati prima che vengano inviati al server. Lo scegli quando accedi per la prima volta a Saber e non è correlato al tuo account/password Nextcloud.

Nessuno può accedere alle tue note sul server senza la tua password di crittografia. Ciò significa anche che se dimentichi la password di crittografia, perderai l'accesso ai tuoi dati.

La password Nextcloud viene utilizzata per accedere al cloud. La password di crittografia "codifica" i tuoi dati prima che raggiungano il cloud.

Anche se qualcuno riesce ad accedere al tuo account Nextcloud, le tue note rimarranno al sicuro e crittografate con una password separata. Questo ti fornisce un secondo livello di sicurezza per proteggere i tuoi dati.

faq(OUTDATED).q: Come faccio ad accedere se utilizzo 2FA?
faq(OUTDATED).a: Invece della tua normale password Nextcloud, dovrai creare una "password per l'app". Puoi farlo nelle impostazioni di Nextcloud in Sicurezza > Dispositivi e sessioni > Crea una nuova password per l'app. La tua password di crittografia rimane inalterata.

faq(OUTDATED).q: Posso usare la stessa password per entrambi?
faq(OUTDATED).a: Sì, ma farlo è meno sicuro. Poiché la tua password Nextcloud viene inviata al server, qualcuno con accesso al server sarebbe in grado di decrittografare le tue note. Usa la stessa password solo se ti fidi del proprietario del server.
Nextcloud is a private file sync server, among other things. You can use the default Saber Nextcloud server, use a third-party server, or self-host your own for full control of your data.

The encryption password is used to encrypt your data before it is sent to the server. You choose it when you first login to Saber, and it's not related to your Nextcloud account/password.

No-one can access your notes on the server without your encryption password. This also means that if you forget your encryption password, you will lose access to your data.

The Nextcloud password is used to access the cloud. The encryption password "scrambles" your data before it ever reaches the cloud.

Even if someone gains access to your Nextcloud account, your notes will remain safe and encrypted with a separate password. This provides you a second layer of security to protect your data.

faq(OUTDATED).q: How do I login if I use 2FA?
faq(OUTDATED).a: Instead of your regular Nextcloud password, you'll need to create an "app password". You can do this in your Nextcloud settings under Security > Devices & sessions > Create new app password. Your encryption password is unaffected.

faq(OUTDATED).q: Can I use the same password for both?
faq(OUTDATED).a: Yes, but doing so is less secure. Since your Nextcloud password is sent to the server, someone with access to the server would be able to decrypt your notes. Only use the same password if you trust the server owner.
